title.rendered: The Best Time To Move To LA

content.rendered:
Living in Los Angeles can be a dream come true for some people. The weather is sunny year-round, there are hundreds of beaches to explore, and the entertainment industry is booming. Yes, Los Angeles is a wonderful (and expensive) place to live. The only catch is, with so many people flocking to the city, it can be hard to know when is the best time to move. Is there a specific season? Will certain things impact your decision, like the cost of living in Los Angeles or food prices in the area? This article will answer all these questions and more, to help you figure out when is the best time to move to LA.

Related: Find Rooms for Rent in LA

Weather

With so many things to consider, it’s hard to know where to start. One important factor in deciding where you want to live is the climate. LA has mild winters and sweltering summers. If you’re looking to relocate when the weather is more temperate, then the best time to move to LA would be between November and February, when it’s not too hot or too cold. Winter, which lasts from November to March, is a very mild and spring-like season. There are many pleasant and sunny days, with daytime temperatures reaching around 20°C (68°F). However, after the rare cold air outbreaks, temperatures at night can approach freezing (0°C or 32°F). In the summer, it may be rather hot, with an average temperature of between 24-25°C (75-77°F). Occasionally, it will be hotter than that, but typically, temperatures don’t reach as high as 30°C (86°F). Even so, prepare to sweat if you’re going to be moving boxes in the summer. November is the best time to move to LA to avoid this.

Cheaper Rent

Another thing that makes November the best time to move to LA is the lower rent! Rental costs in Los Angeles peak in June, when they are around 4.1% higher than in November, which is the least expensive month of the year. In Los Angeles, prices for both one- and two-bedroom apartments drop to their lowest points between November and January. One-bedroom prices spike in March, June, and July, while two-bedrooms get pricey (or, you know, pricier than usual) in June and October.

Related: Pros and Cons Of Living in Los Angeles

Neighborhood, Cost, and Availability

When moving to Los Angeles, you’ll want to make sure that the location you wish to live in has a decent selection of apartments available for you to choose from. Due to the increase in apartment availability in the wake of the pandemic, you might also be able to secure a better lease. When an apartment has been on the market for a long time, landlords are more likely to negotiate. So, right now might be the best time to move to LA from that perspective.

School Enrolment and Job Opportunities

If you have school-aged children, you might be better off moving in June or July, even if it is more expensive. That way, they will have more time to get used to their new home and surroundings before school starts up. It’s also important to consider the location of the property you’re looking at renting, as you won’t want to live too far from the school or your workplace.

The job market in Los Angeles is extremely competitive. If you are presently unemployed and looking for work, you may have a better chance of finding a job before you relocate to the city than if you wait until you arrive. Rent is quite high in this city, and unless you have a substantial cash buffer, you will run into financial difficulties without a job. Also keep in mind that many of the younger residents here, who include students and young professionals, share an apartment with at least one roommate in order to save money.

Related: Living Cost In Los Angeles For Students: The Complete Guide

Holiday Events

With so many holidays and events lined up in December, November is the best time to move to LA. Moving to Los Angeles opens up opportunities to meet people from wide range of cultures and backgrounds. In Los Angeles, people celebrate Christmas and Hanukkah in a number of ways throughout the festive season! There’s sure to be something for everyone among the numerous entertaining Christmas and holiday activities in Los Angeles. Look for:

  • Las Posadas
  • Outdoor ice skating
  • Meeting Santa Claus
  • Hanukkah celebrations
  • Christmas boat parades

Exciting events like these make living in Los Angeles fun!
